io.spine.server.entity

Class Transaction<I,E extends TransactionalEntity<I,S,B>,S extends com.google.protobuf.Message,B extends io.spine.validate.ValidatingBuilder<S,? extends com.google.protobuf.Message.Builder>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.entity.Transaction<I,E,S,B>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of entity IDs
    E - the type of entity
    S - the type of entity state
    B - the type of a ValidatingBuilder for the entity state
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EventPlayingTransaction, PmTransaction

    @Internal
public abstract class Transaction<I,E extends TransactionalEntity<I,S,B>,S extends com.google.protobuf.Message,B extends io.spine.validate.ValidatingBuilder<S,? extends com.google.protobuf.Message.Builder>>
extends java.lang.Object
    The abstract class for the entity transactions.

    The transaction is a set of changes made to an entity state or entity attributes (e.g. version, lifecycle flags etc).

    Serves as a buffer, accumulating the changes, intended for the enclosed Entity; the changes are only applied to the actual object upon commit.

    The transaction is injected to the entity, which state should be modified. By doing so, the "buffering" builder is exposed to concrete TransactionalEntity subclasses. In turn, they receive an ability to change the entity state by modifying entity state builder.

    Same applies to the entity lifecycle flags.

    Version management is performed automatically by the transaction itself.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Transaction(E entity)
      Creates a new instance of Transaction and injects the newly created transaction into the given entity.
      protected Transaction(E entity, S state, io.spine.core.Version version)
      Acts similar to an overloaded ctor, but instead of using the original entity state and version, this transaction will have the passed state and version as a starting point.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Transaction

        protected Transaction(E entity)
        Creates a new instance of Transaction and injects the newly created transaction into the given entity.

        The entity state and attributes are set as starting values for this transaction.

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to create the transaction for
        See Also:
        TransactionListener

      • Transaction

        protected Transaction(E entity,
                      S state,
                      io.spine.core.Version version)
        Acts similar to an overloaded ctor, but instead of using the original entity state and version, this transaction will have the passed state and version as a starting point.

        Note, that the given state and version are applied to the actual entity upon commit.

        Parameters:
        entity - the target entity to modify within this transaction
        state - the entity state to set
        version - the entity version to set

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Allows to understand whether this transaction is active.
        Returns:
        true if the transaction is active, false otherwise

      • getEntity

        protected E getEntity()

      • propagate

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
protected <R> R propagate(Phase<I,R> phase)
        Propagates a phase and performs a rollback in case of an exception.

        The transaction listener is called for both failed and successful phases.

        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the phase propagation result
        Parameters:
        phase - the phase to propagate
        Returns:
        the phase propagation result

      • commit

        protected void commit()
               throws InvalidEntityStateException,
                      java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Applies all the outstanding modifications to the enclosed entity.
        Throws:
        InvalidEntityStateException - in case the new entity state is not valid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - in case of a generic error

      • setListener

        public void setListener(TransactionListener<I,E,S,B> listener)
        Injects a listener into this transaction.

        Each next invocation overrides the previous one.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to use in this transaction
